content: On November 12, 1990, the Atlanta Braves made a significant move by trading for future Hall of Famer Fred McGriff. The Braves acquired McGriff from the San Diego Padres in exchange for a package that included prospects, marking a pivotal moment in their history as McGriff would go on to become a cornerstone of the team's offense. His power-hitting ability and leadership would help the Braves secure a World Series title in 1995, solidifying his legacy in Atlanta.
